title: And the current frontrunners for our Spring '25 architecture school lecture poster vote are...
author: Alexander Walter
excerpt: Already cast your vote for your favorite Spring '25 architecture school lecture poster(s) yet? Archinect's reader poll to select the most popular graphic design of the 25 posters we presented for that academic term in our ongoing Get Lectured series opened last week and will run until Tuesday...
text: anchor Already cast your vote for your favorite Spring '25 architecture school lecture poster(s) yet? Archinect's reader poll to select the most popular graphic design of the 25 posters we presented for that academic term in our ongoing Get Lectured series opened last week and will run until Tuesday, June 24, noon Pacific Time. Currently, the school whose lecture poster received the most votes is UCLA's School of Architecture and Urban Design, with 29.5%, ahead of East Los Angeles College's Architecture Department in second place, with 15.5%, and Cal Poly San Luis Obispo's College of Architecture and Environmental Design in third place, with 14.0%. In fourth place at the moment is the Pratt School of Architecture, with 13.5% of votes. Take a look at the posters we've presented throughout the Spring '25 term, and select your favorite pick(s) in the poll below. The lecture posters with the most votes will be announced on Wednesday, June 25. Have fun! Want to share your school's new lecture series and be included in the upcoming Fall 2025 series? Send us your poster design and event details.
html:
• anchor

    Already cast your vote for your favorite Spring '25 architecture school lecture poster(s) yet?

    Archinect's reader poll to select the most popular graphic design of the 25 posters we presented for that academic term in our ongoing Get Lectured series opened last week and will run until Tuesday, June 24, noon Pacific Time.

    Currently, the school whose lecture poster received the most votes is UCLA's School of Architecture and Urban Design, with 29.5%, ahead of East Los Angeles College's Architecture Department in second place, with 15.5%, and Cal Poly San Luis Obispo's College of Architecture and Environmental Design in third place, with 14.0%. In fourth place at the moment is the Pratt School of Architecture, with 13.5% of votes.

    Take a look at the posters we've presented throughout the Spring '25 term, and select your favorite pick(s) in the poll below.

    The lecture posters with the most votes will be announced on Wednesday, June 25. Have fun!

    Want to share your school's new lecture series and be included in the upcoming Fall 2025 series? Send us your poster design and event details.
